text: <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants are considered as unfavorable factors for the effectiveness in radiotherapy and TMZ treatment in glioma cells ( Gjerset et al . , 1995 ; Hirose et al . , 2001 ; Squatrito et al . , 2010 ; Blough et al . , 2011 ) .

Loss of functional <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> confers sensitivity to TMZ in glioma cells , whereas wild type <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increases the TMZ resistance ( Blough et al . , 2011 ) .
<extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants reduce TMZ sensitivity in gliomas ( Blough et al . , 2011 ) .

Altered <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is shown in GBMs , in which downregulation of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is associated with loss of heterozygosity and promoter methylation ( Kosla et al . , 2011 ) .

Recently , we demonstrated that overexpressed <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces apoptosis of glioblastoma U373-MG cells harboring mutant <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by causing hypoploidy and DNA fragmentation ( Chiang et al . , 2012 ) .
However , ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has no effect with U87-MG expressing wild type <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Unlike TMZ , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces apoptosis of U373-MG cells via a mitochondria - independent and <extra_id_0> caspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent pathway ( Chiang et al . , 2012 ) .

While the underlying mechanisms are unknown , it is reasonable to assume that the survival of human glioblastoma cells depends upon interactions between the gain-of-function of <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants and <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Activated <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds wild type <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with Ser46 phosphorylation ( Chang et al . , 2005b ) .
UV irradiation enhances the binding interactions .

Despite the presence of Ser46 in <extra_id_0> delta40p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , binding of this protein with <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> remains to be determined .

We postulate that in GBM cells , both wild type <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins appear to have a functional antagonism , thereby nullifying each other 's function in inducing apoptosis ( Figure 2 ) .

Mutant <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins can not bind ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in GBM cells , and <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is able to induce apoptosis .
Whether <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> causes apoptosis in GBM expressing <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> isoforms is unknown and remains to be established .
